answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!If all other causes like infection, stone and STD (if there is a history) have been ruled out, then you must look at allergy to soaps, shampoos, undergarments etc. Also at times the burning etc is due to dehydration. Taking plenty of water and other fluids will help. Also diabetes should be ruled out.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: My adult daughter (Age 25) is suffering from pain at Urine Part. The issue is frequency of Urine / Burning Sensation / Pain at Urine Part since last 5 years. We have consulted few Urologist Doctors in Pune / Bombay and carried out related medical investigation as per the advice.However all Clinical / Pathological medical reports as regard to Urine and related part is quite normal and there is no defect / damage / disorder noticed / revealed in the all related reports.Now would you guide us as to the solution of the medical problem as regard to urine and/or suggest us certain doctor / Institution for the said problem.
title: Urology Query
